p: Continental Europe, including Croatia, has a great wildlife biodiversity, including a wide range of rodent species and other small mammals that have been reported as reservoirs of several clinically important bacterial, protozoan, and viral diseases [ 17]. Due to its diverse natural habitats and possible wildlife/domestic animals/public interactions, there is a potential for many rodent-borne zoonoses. This study presents the first report of a natural HEV-3 infection of a small rodent.
